edu.nyu.cs.javagit.client
Interface IGitBranch

All Known Implementing Classes:
CliGitBranch
public interface IGitBranch

An interface to represent the git-branch command.

Method Summary
 GitBranchResponse branch(java.io.File repositoryPath)
          Does a basic git-branch without any options.
 GitBranchResponse branch(java.io.File repositoryPath, GitBranchOptions options)
          Perform git-branch with the specified options against the repository.
 GitBranchResponse createBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath, GitBranchOptions options, Ref branchName)
          Creates a branch according to given option.
 GitBranchResponse createBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath, GitBranchOptions options, Ref branchName, Ref startPoint)
          Creates a branch according to given option.
 GitBranchResponse createBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath, Ref branchName)
          Creates a branch.
 GitBranchResponse createBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath, Ref branchName, Ref startPoint)
          Creates a branch.
 GitBranchResponse deleteBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath, boolean forceDelete, boolean remote, Ref branchName)
          Deletes the specified branch using the -d or -D command line option.
 GitBranchResponse deleteBranches(java.io.File repositoryPath, boolean forceDelete, boolean remote, java.util.List<Ref> branchList)
          Deletes the specified branches using the -d command line option.
 GitBranchResponse renameBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath, boolean forceRename, Ref newName)
          Renames the current branch to new branch.
 GitBranchResponse renameBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath, boolean forceRename, Ref oldName, Ref newName)
          Renames old branch to new branch.
 

Method Detail

branch

GitBranchResponse branch(java.io.File repositoryPath)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                JavaGitException
Does a basic git-branch without any options. Displays branches.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - A File instance for the path to the repository. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
Returns:
The result of the git branch.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-branch.

branch

GitBranchResponse branch(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                         GitBranchOptions options)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                JavaGitException
Perform git-branch with the specified options against the repository. Displays branches.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - A File instance for the path to the repository. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
options - The options for a git-branch command. If the value is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
Returns:
The result of the git branch.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-branch.

deleteBranch

GitBranchResponse deleteBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                               boolean forceDelete,
                               boolean remote,
                               Ref branchName)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      JavaGitException
Deletes the specified branch using the -d or -D command line option.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - A File instance for the path to the repository. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
forceDelete - True if force delete option -D should be used, false if -d should be used.
remote - True if delete branch should be acted upon a remote branch.
branchName - A branch to be deleted.
Returns:
The result of the git-branch with delete option.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-branch.

deleteBranches

GitBranchResponse deleteBranches(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                                 boolean forceDelete,
                                 boolean remote,
                                 java.util.List<Ref> branchList)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        JavaGitException
Deletes the specified branches using the -d command line option.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - A File instance for the path to the repository. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
forceDelete - True if force delete option -D should be used, false if -d should be used.
remote - True if delete branch should be acted upon a remote branch list.
branchList - The list of branches to be deleted.
Returns:
The result of the git-branch with -d option.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-branch.

renameBranch

GitBranchResponse renameBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                               boolean forceRename,
                               Ref newName)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      JavaGitException
Renames the current branch to new branch.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - A File instance for the path to the repository. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
forceRename - True if force rename option -M should be used. False if -m should be used.
newName - When renaming the current branch to a new branch name, this is the new branch name.
Returns:
The result of the git branch with -m option.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-branch.

renameBranch

GitBranchResponse renameBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                               boolean forceRename,
                               Ref oldName,
                               Ref newName)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      JavaGitException
Renames old branch to new branch.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - A File instance for the path to the repository. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
forceRename - True if force rename option -M should be used. False if -m should be used.
oldName - When renaming a branch to a different name, this is the old branch name.
newName - When renaming a branch to a new branch name, this is the new branch name.
Returns:
The result of the git branch with -m option.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-branch.

createBranch

GitBranchResponse createBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                               Ref branchName)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      JavaGitException
Creates a branch. Indicates to use the current working branch as the branch start point.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - A File instance for the path to the repository. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
branchName - Name of the branch to create.
Returns:
The result of the git branch with -m option.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-branch.

createBranch

GitBranchResponse createBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                               GitBranchOptions options,
                               Ref branchName)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      JavaGitException
Creates a branch according to given option. Indicate to use the current working branch as the branch start point.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - A File instance for the path to the repository. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
options - The options for a git-branch command. If the value is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
branchName - Name of the branch to create.
Returns:
The result of the git branch with -m option.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-branch.

createBranch

GitBranchResponse createBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                               Ref branchName,
                               Ref startPoint)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      JavaGitException
Creates a branch. Uses the startPoint as the branch start point.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - A File instance for the path to the repository. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
branchName - Name of the branch to create.
startPoint - Start point of the newly created branch.
Returns:
The result of the git branch with -m option.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-branch.

createBranch

GitBranchResponse createBranch(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                               GitBranchOptions options,
                               Ref branchName,
                               Ref startPoint)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      JavaGitException
Creates a branch according to given option. Allow the startPoint to be null to indicate to use the current working branch as the branch start point.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - A File instance for the path to the repository. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
options - The options for a git-branch command. If the value is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
branchName - Name of the branch to create.
startPoint - Start point of the newly created branch.
Returns:
The result of the git branch with -m option.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git-branch.
